reviews.review_msg: Taught the class for the first time and used that as an excuse to be totally disorganized. Grading between her and the TA was inconsistent. Averages for the drafts were in the 50%s. Her expectations are nowhere to be found as the whole class never knew what they were doing. Also never answers emails so you won't get any help from her.

Boring, disorganized and rambles. Gives no clear expectations and her feedback is unconstructive. Her first time teaching the class is not an excuse for not creating material that actually work towards creating a good argumentative linguistic paper. She finally gave a guideline about what she wants in papers in the 2nd to last class. Way too late

The grading on the papers was a tough but it was an interesting course that taught a lot about syntax. Trevor responds quickly to all of my emails and met on Zoom whenever I asked. I recommend this course if you took LING 322 already!

Took 222, 322 and 301W with him. You can get away with not reading the textbook because his slides are quite thorough.  His tests are fair and are usually mostly based on the quizzes and homework. My writing improved a lot since he is really good at explaining how to make solid arguments.
